instructions.title: SURFACE PREPARATION
instructions.data: Allow new concrete to dry for 14-28 days under normal weather conditions before painting. Surface to be painted should be clean and dry, free from oil, grease, dust, dirt, contaminants, and all loose grit and mortar. If neutralizing, treat surface with a solution of 1 part BOYSEN®® Masonry Neutralizer B‑44 diluted in 16 parts water, applying liberally by brush or roller. Let dry overnight before rinsing with water to remove white crystals that form on the surface. Let dry before painting. Note: If the concrete has been cured for more than 28 days, there is no need for neutralizer.

instructions.title: PAINTING SCHEDULE
instructions.data: Prime bare concrete with BOYSEN®® Permacoat™ Flat Latex B‑701. Fully cover the entire surface using BOYSEN®® DECORe™ Undercoat B‑4605 by brush or roller. Let dry for 1 hour before applying the succeeding layer. Mix BOYSEN®® DECORe™ Toner into BOYSEN®® DECORe™ Base B‑4610. A color can be applied in different tones by varying amount of toner used, either Full, One-half, One- Fourth, or any other proportion depending on desired shade. Stir until uniform consistency is achieved. Using a BOYSEN®® DECORe™ brush, apply the prepared BOYSEN®® DECORe™ Base with Toner starting from top corner, working with short crisscrossing strokes. Brush through surface while the paint is still wet to achieve a more uniform pattern. Wait for 8-10 minutes after applying BOYSEN®® DECORe™. Then, lightly comb the surface using the plastic scraper with long crisscrossing strokes, the scraper inclined and close to the surface.

instructions.title: NOTES
instructions.data: Do not thin mixture with water or any solvent. Designs can only be achieved using BOYSEN®® DECORe™ Undercoat. Only use the provided BOYSEN®® DECORe™ Brush and Scraper. The desired finish may not be achieved if a different material is used.
